level-up.name: tackle
level-up.description:
A physical attack in which the user charges and
slams into the target with its whole body.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.

level-up.name: leer
level-up.description:
The user gives opposing Pokémon an intimidating
leer that lowers the Defense stat.
level-up.effect: Lowers the target's Defense by one stage.

level-up.name: bite
level-up.description:
The target is bitten with viciously sharp fangs.
This may also make the target flinch.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.

level-up.name: low-kick
level-up.description:
A powerful low kick that makes the target fall over.
The heavier the target, the greater the move’s power.
level-up.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases with the target's weight in kilograms, to a maximum of 120.

Target's weight | Power
--------------- | ----:
Up to 10kg      |    20
Up to 25kg      |    40
Up to 50kg      |    60
Up to 100kg     |    80
Up to 200kg     |   100
Above 200kg     |   120

level-up.name: leer
level-up.description:
The user gives opposing Pokémon an intimidating
leer that lowers the Defense stat.
level-up.effect: Lowers the target's Defense by one stage.

level-up.name: bite
level-up.description:
The target is bitten with viciously sharp fangs.
This may also make the target flinch.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.

level-up.name: bide
level-up.description:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
level-up.effect:
User waits for two turns.  On the second turn, the user inflicts twice the damage it accumulated on the last Pokémon to hit it.  Damage inflicted is typeless.

This move cannot be selected by sleep talk.

level-up.name: detect
level-up.description:
This move enables the user to protect itself from
all attacks. Its chance of failing rises if it is used
in succession.
level-up.effect:
No moves will hit the user for the remainder of this turn.  If the user is last to act this turn, this move will fail.

If the user successfully used detect, endure, protect, quick guard, or wide guard on the last turn, this move has a 50% chance to fail.

lock on, mind reader, and no guard provide a (100 – accuracy)% chance for moves to break through this move.  This does not apply to one-hit KO moves (fissure, guillotine, horn drill, and sheer cold); those are always blocked by this move.

thunder during rain dance and blizzard during hail have a 30% chance to break through this move.

The following effects are not prevented by this move:

* acupressure from an ally
* curse's curse effect
* Delayed damage from doom desire and future sight; however, these moves will be prevented if they are used this turn
* feint, which will also end this move's protection after it hits
* imprison
* perish song
* shadow force
* Moves that merely copy the user, such as transform or psych up

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.

level-up.name: sand-attack
level-up.description:
Sand is hurled in the target’s face, reducing the
target’s accuracy.
level-up.effect: Lowers the target's accuracy by one stage.

level-up.name: crunch
level-up.description:
The user crunches up the target with sharp fangs.
This may also lower the target’s Defense stat.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 20% chance to lower the target's Defense by one stage.

level-up.name: hypnosis
level-up.description:
The user employs hypnotic suggestion to make the
target fall into a deep sleep.
level-up.effect: Puts the target to sleep.

level-up.name: confuse-ray
level-up.description:
The target is exposed to a sinister ray that
triggers confusion.
level-up.effect: Confuses the target.

level-up.name: super-fang
level-up.description:
The user chomps hard on the target with its sharp
front fangs. This cuts the target’s HP in half.
level-up.effect: Inflicts typeless damage equal to half the target's remaining HP.

level-up.name: after-you
level-up.description:
The user helps the target and makes it use its move
right after the user.
level-up.effect:
The target will act next this turn, regardless of Speed or move priority.
If the target has already acted this turn, this move will fail.

level-up.name: psych-up
level-up.description:
The user hypnotizes itself into copying any stat
change made by the target.
level-up.effect:
Discards the user's stat changes and copies the target's.

This move cannot be copied by mirror move.

level-up.name: hyper-fang
level-up.description:
The user bites hard on the target with its sharp
front fangs. This may also make the target flinch.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to make the target flinch.

level-up.name: mean-look
level-up.description:
The user pins the target with a dark, arresting look.
The target becomes unable to flee.
level-up.effect:
The target cannot switch out normally.  Ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.  This effect ends when the user leaves the field.

The target may still escape by using baton pass, u turn, or a shed shell.

Both the user and the target pass on this effect with baton pass.

level-up.name: baton-pass
level-up.description:
The user switches places with a party Pokémon in
waiting and passes along any stat changes.
level-up.effect:
User switches out, and the trainer selects a replacement Pokémon from the party.  Stat changes, confusion, and persistent move effects are passed along to the replacement Pokémon.

The following move effects are passed:

* aqua ring
* both the user's and target's effect of block, mean look, and spider web
* the curse effect of curse
* embargo
* focus energy or an activated lansat berry
* gastro acid
* ingrain
* being sapped by leech seed
* being targeted by lock on or mind reader
* magnet rise
* perish song's counter
* power trick
* substitute; the doll's HP is unchanged

The replacement Pokémon does not trigger effects that respond to Pokémon switching in.

level-up.name: slam
level-up.description:
The target is slammed with a long tail, vines, or the
like to inflict damage.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.

tutor.name: fire-punch
tutor.description:
The target is punched with a fiery fist. This may also
leave the target with a burn.
tutor.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to burn the target.

tutor.name: ice-punch
tutor.description:
The target is punched with an icy fist. This may also
leave the target frozen.
tutor.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to freeze the target.

tutor.name: thunder-punch
tutor.description:
The target is punched with an electrified fist.
This may also leave the target with paralysis.
tutor.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to paralyze the target.

tutor.name: low-kick
tutor.description:
A powerful low kick that makes the target fall over.
The heavier the target, the greater the move’s power.
tutor.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases with the target's weight in kilograms, to a maximum of 120.

Target's weight | Power
--------------- | ----:
Up to 10kg      |    20
Up to 25kg      |    40
Up to 50kg      |    60
Up to 100kg     |    80
Up to 200kg     |   100
Above 200kg     |   120

tutor.name: super-fang
tutor.description:
The user chomps hard on the target with its sharp
front fangs. This cuts the target’s HP in half.
tutor.effect: Inflicts typeless damage equal to half the target's remaining HP.

tutor.name: snore
tutor.description:
This attack can be used only if the user is asleep.
The harsh noise may also make the target flinch.
tutor.effect: Only usable if the user is sleeping.  Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.

tutor.name: sleep-talk
tutor.description:
While it is asleep, the user randomly uses one of the
moves it knows.
tutor.effect:
Only usable if the user is sleeping.  Randomly selects and uses one of the user's other three moves.  Use of the selected move requires and costs 0 PP.

This move will not select assist, bide, bounce, chatter, copycat, dig, dive, fly, focus punch, me first, metronome, mirror move, shadow force, skull bash, sky attack, sky drop, sleep talk, solar beam, razor wind, or uproar.

If the selected move requires a recharge turn—i.e., one of blast burn, frenzy plant, giga impact, hydro cannon, hyper beam, roar of time, or rock wrecker—and the user is still sleeping next turn, then it's forced to use this move again and pay another PP for the recharge turn.

This move cannot be copied by mirror move, nor selected by assist, metronome, or sleep talk.

tutor.name: iron-tail
tutor.description:
The target is slammed with a steel-hard tail.
This may also lower the target’s Defense stat.
tutor.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to lower the target's Defense by one stage.

tutor.name: helping-hand
tutor.description:
The user assists an ally by boosting the power of
that ally’s attack.
tutor.effect:
Boosts the power of the target's moves by 50% until the end of this turn.

This move cannot be copied by mirror move, nor selected by assist or metronome.

tutor.name: knock-off
tutor.description:
The user slaps down the target’s held item, and that
item can’t be used in that battle. The move does
more damage if the target has a held item.
tutor.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  Target loses its held item.

Neither the user nor the target can recover its item with recycle.

If the target has multitype or sticky hold, it will take damage but not lose its item.

tutor.name: endeavor
tutor.description:
This attack move cuts down the target’s HP to equal
the user’s HP.
tutor.effect: Inflicts exactly enough damage to lower the target's HP to equal the user's.  If the target's HP is not higher than the user's, this move has no effect.  Type immunity applies, but other type effects are ignored.  This effect counts as damage for moves that respond to damage.

tutor.name: signal-beam
tutor.description:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
tutor.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to confuse the target.

tutor.name: covet
tutor.description:
The user endearingly approaches the target, then
steals the target’s held item.
tutor.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  If the target is holding an item and the user is not, the user will permanently take the item.  Damage is still inflicted if an item cannot be taken.

Pokémon with sticky hold or multitype are immune to the item theft effect.

The target cannot recover its item with recycle.

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.

tutor.name: last-resort
tutor.description:
This move can be used only after the user has used
all the other moves it knows in the battle.
tutor.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  This move can only be used if each of the user's other moves has been used at least once since the user entered the field.  If this is the user's only move, this move will fail.

tutor.name: aqua-tail
tutor.description:
The user attacks by swinging its tail as if it were a
vicious wave in a raging storm.

tutor.name: seed-bomb
tutor.description:
The user slams a barrage of hard-shelled seeds
down on the target from above.

tutor.name: zen-headbutt
tutor.description:
The user focuses its willpower to its head and
attacks the target. This may also make the
target flinch.
tutor.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 20% chance to make the target flinch.

tutor.name: gunk-shot
tutor.description:
The user shoots filthy garbage at the target to
attack. This may also poison the target.
tutor.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to poison the target.

tutor.name: after-you
tutor.description:
The user helps the target and makes it use its move
right after the user.
tutor.effect:
The target will act next this turn, regardless of Speed or move priority.
If the target has already acted this turn, this move will fail.

machine.name: cut
machine.description: The target is cut with a scythe or claw.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.

machine.name: strength
machine.description:
The target is slugged with a punch thrown at
maximum power.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.

machine.name: toxic
machine.description:
A move that leaves the target badly poisoned.
Its poison damage worsens every turn.
machine.effect: Badly poisons the target.  Never misses when used by a poison-type Pokémon.

machine.name: hidden-power
machine.description:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  Power and type are determined by the user's IVs.

Power is given by `x * 40 / 63 + 30`.  `x` is obtained by arranging bit 1 from the IV for each of Special Defense, Special Attack, Speed, Defense, Attack, and HP in that order.  (Bit 1 is 1 if the IV is of the form `4n + 2` or `4n + 3`.  `x` is then 64 * Special Defense IV bit 1, plus 32 * Special Attack IV bit 1, etc.)

Power is always between 30 and 70, inclusive.  Average power is 49.5.

Type is given by `y * 15 / 63`, where `y` is similar to `x` above, except constructed from bit 0.  (Bit 0 is 1 if the IV is odd.)  The result is looked up in the following table.

Value | Type
----: | --------
    0 | fighting
    1 | flying
    2 | poison
    3 | ground
    4 | rock
    5 | bug
    6 | ghost
    7 | steel
    8 | fire
    9 | water
   10 | grass
   11 | electric
   12 | psychic
   13 | ice
   14 | dragon
   15 | dark

This move thus cannot be normal.  Most other types have an equal 1/16 chance to be selected, given random IVs.  However, due to the flooring used here, bug, fighting, and grass appear 5/64 of the time, and dark only 1/64 of the time.

machine.name: sunny-day
machine.description:
The user intensifies the sun for five turns, powering
up Fire-type moves. It lowers the power of
Water-type moves.
machine.effect:
Changes the weather to sunshine for five turns, during which fire moves inflict 50% extra damage, and water moves inflict half damage.

If the user is holding heat rock, this effect lasts for eight turns.

Pokémon cannot become frozen.

thunder has 50% accuracy.

solar beam skips its charge turn.

moonlight, morning sun, and synthesis heal 2/3 of the user's max HP.

Pokémon with chlorophyll have doubled original Speed.

Pokémon with forecast become fire.

Pokémon with leaf guard are not affected by major status effects.

Pokémon with flower gift change form; every Pokémon on their side of the field have their original Attack and Special Attack increased by 50%.

Pokémon with dry skin lose 1/8 max HP at the end of each turn.

Pokémon with solar power have their original Special Attack raised by 50% but lose 1/8 their max HP at the end of each turn.

machine.name: hyper-beam
machine.description:
The target is attacked with a powerful beam.
The user can’t move on the next turn.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  User loses its next turn to "recharge", and cannot attack or switch out during that turn.

machine.name: light-screen
machine.description:
A wondrous wall of light is put up to reduce damage
from special attacks for five turns.
machine.effect:
Erects a barrier around the user's side of the field that reduces damage from special attacks by half for five turns.  In double battles, the reduction is 1/3.  Critical hits are not affected by the barrier.

If the user is holding light clay, the barrier lasts for eight turns.

brick break or defog used by an opponent will destroy the barrier.

machine.name: protect
machine.description:
This move enables the user to protect itself from
all attacks. Its chance of failing rises if it is used
in succession.
machine.effect:
No moves will hit the user for the remainder of this turn.  If the user is last to act this turn, this move will fail.

If the user successfully used detect, endure, protect, quick guard, or wide guard on the last turn, this move has a 50% chance to fail.

lock on, mind reader, and no guard provide a (100 – accuracy)% chance for moves to break through this move.  This does not apply to one-hit KO moves (fissure, guillotine, horn drill, and sheer cold); those are always blocked by this move.

thunder during rain dance and blizzard during hail have a 30% chance to break through this move.

The following effects are not prevented by this move:

* acupressure from an ally
* curse's curse effect
* Delayed damage from doom desire and future sight; however, these moves will be prevented if they are used this turn
* feint, which will also end this move's protection after it hits
* imprison
* perish song
* shadow force
* Moves that merely copy the user, such as transform or psych up

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.

machine.name: rain-dance
machine.description:
The user summons a heavy rain that falls for five
turns, powering up Water-type moves. It lowers
the power of Fire-type moves.
machine.effect:
Changes the weather to rain for five turns, during which water moves inflict 50% extra damage, and fire moves inflict half damage.

If the user is holding damp rock, this effect lasts for eight turns.

thunder has 100% accuracy.  If the target has used detect or protect, thunder has a (100 - accuracy)% chance to break through the protection.

solar beam has half power.

moonlight, morning sun, and synthesis heal only 1/4 of the user's max HP.

Pokémon with swift swim have doubled original Speed.

Pokémon with forecast become water.

Pokémon with dry skin heal 1/8 max HP, Pokémon with hydration are cured of major status effects, and Pokémon with rain dish heal 1/16 max HP at the end of each turn.

machine.name: frustration
machine.description:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases inversely with happiness, given by `(255 - happiness) * 2 / 5`, to a maximum of 102.  Power bottoms out at 1.

machine.name: thunderbolt
machine.description:
A strong electric blast crashes down on the target.
This may also leave the target with paralysis.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to paralyze the target.

machine.name: thunder
machine.description:
A wicked thunderbolt is dropped on the target to
inflict damage. This may also leave the target
with paralysis.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to paralyze the target.

During rain dance, this move has 100% accuracy.  It also has a (100 - accuracy)% chance to break through the protection of protect and detect.

During sunny day, this move has 50% accuracy.

machine.name: return
machine.description:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases with happiness, given by `happiness * 2 / 5`, to a maximum of 102.  Power bottoms out at 1.

machine.name: dig
machine.description:
The user burrows into the ground, then attacks on
the next turn.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  User digs underground for one turn, becoming immune to attack, and hits on the second turn.

During the immune turn, earthquake, fissure, and magnitude still hit the user normally, and their power is doubled if appropriate.

The user may be hit during its immune turn if under the effect of lock on, mind reader, or no guard.

This move cannot be selected by sleep talk.

machine.name: shadow-ball
machine.description:
The user hurls a shadowy blob at the target.
This may also lower the target’s Sp. Def stat.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 20% chance to lower the target's Special Defense by one stage.

machine.name: double-team
machine.description:
By moving rapidly, the user makes illusory copies of
itself to raise its evasiveness.
machine.effect: Raises the user's evasion by one stage.

machine.name: flamethrower
machine.description:
The target is scorched with an intense blast of fire.
This may also leave the target with a burn.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to burn the target.

machine.name: facade
machine.description:
This attack move doubles its power if the user is
poisoned, burned, or paralyzed.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  If the user is burned, paralyzed, or poisoned, this move has double power.

machine.name: rest
machine.description:
The user goes to sleep for two turns. This fully
restores the user’s HP and heals any
status conditions.
machine.effect:
User falls to sleep and immediately regains all its HP.  If the user has another major status effect, sleep will replace it.  The user will always wake up after two turns, or one turn with early bird.

This move fails if the Pokémon cannot fall asleep due to uproar, insomnia, or vital spirit.  It also fails if the Pokémon is at full health or is already asleep.

machine.name: attract
machine.description:
If it is the opposite gender of the user, the target
becomes infatuated and less likely to attack.
machine.effect: Causes the target to fall in love with the user, giving it a 50% chance to do nothing each turn.  If the user and target are the same gender, or either is genderless, this move will fail.  If either Pokémon leaves the field, this effect ends.

machine.name: round
machine.description:
The user attacks the target with a song. Others can
join in the Round to increase the power of
the attack.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  If round has already been used this turn, this move's power is doubled.  After this move is used, any other Pokémon using it this turn will immediately do so (in the order they would otherwise act), regardless of Speed or priority.  Pokémon using other moves will then continue to act as usual.

machine.name: focus-blast
machine.description:
The user heightens its mental focus and unleashes
its power. This may also lower the target’s
Sp. Def stat.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to lower the target's Special Defense by one stage.

machine.name: fling
machine.description:
The user flings its held item at the target to attack.
This move’s power and effects depend on the item.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  Power and type are determined by the user's held item.  The item is consumed.  If the user is not holding an item, or its item has no set type and power, this move will fail.

This move ignores sticky hold.

If the user is under the effect of embargo, this move will fail.

machine.name: retaliate
machine.description:
The user gets revenge for a fainted ally. If an ally
fainted in the previous turn, this move’s power
is increased.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  If a friendly Pokémon fainted on the previous turn, this move has double power.

machine.name: giga-impact
machine.description:
The user charges at the target using every bit of its
power. The user can’t move on the next turn.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  User loses its next turn to "recharge", and cannot attack or switch out during that turn.

machine.name: flash
machine.description:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
machine.effect: Lowers the target's accuracy by one stage.

machine.name: thunder-wave
machine.description:
The user launches a weak jolt of electricity that
paralyzes the target.
machine.effect: Paralyzes the target.

machine.name: swords-dance
machine.description:
A frenetic dance to uplift the fighting spirit.
This sharply raises the user’s Attack stat.
machine.effect: Raises the user's Attack by two stages.

machine.name: psych-up
machine.description:
The user hypnotizes itself into copying any stat
change made by the target.
machine.effect:
Discards the user's stat changes and copies the target's.

This move cannot be copied by mirror move.

machine.name: work-up
machine.description:
The user is roused, and its Attack and Sp. Atk
stats increase.
machine.effect: Raises the user's Attack and Special Attack by one stage each.

machine.name: dream-eater
machine.description:
The user eats the dreams of a sleeping target.
The user’s HP is restored by half the damage taken by
the target.
machine.effect: Fails if not used on a sleeping Pokémon.  Inflicts regular damage.  Drains half the damage inflicted to heal the user.

machine.name: grass-knot
machine.description:
The user snares the target with grass and trips it.
The heavier the target, the greater the
move’s power.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases with the target's weight in kilograms, to a maximum of 120.

Target's weight | Power
--------------- | ----:
Up to 10kg      |    20
Up to 25kg      |    40
Up to 50kg      |    60
Up to 100kg     |    80
Up to 200kg     |   100
Above 200kg     |   120

machine.name: swagger
machine.description:
The user enrages and confuses the target. However,
this also sharply raises the target’s Attack stat.
machine.effect: Raises the target's Attack by two stages, then confuses it.  If the target's Attack cannot be raised by two stages, the confusion is not applied.

machine.name: substitute
machine.description:
The user creates a substitute for itself using some of
its HP. The substitute serves as the user’s decoy.
machine.effect:
Transfers 1/4 the user's max HP into a doll that absorbs damage and causes most negative move effects to fail.  If the user leaves the field, the doll will vanish.  If the user cannot pay the HP cost, this move will fail.

The doll takes damage as normal, using the user's stats and types, and will break when its HP reaches zero.  Self-inflicted damage from confusion or recoil is not absorbed.  Healing effects from opponents ignore the doll and heal the user as normal.  Moves that work based on the user's HP still do so; the doll's HP does not influence any move.

The doll will block major status effects, confusion, and flinching.  The effects of smelling salts and wake up slap do not trigger against a doll, even if the Pokémon behind the doll has the appropriate major status effect.  Multi-turn trapping moves like wrap will hit the doll for their regular damage, but the multi-turn trapping and damage effects will not activate.

Moves blocked or damage absorbed by the doll do not count as hitting the user or inflicting damage for any effects that respond to such, e.g., avalanche, counter, or a rowap berry.  magic coat still works as normal, even against moves the doll would block.  Opposing Pokémon that damage the doll with a leech move like absorb are healed as normal.

It will also block acupressure, block, the curse effect of curse, dream eater, embargo, flatter, gastro acid, grudge, heal block, leech seed, lock on, mean look, mimic, mind reader, nightmare, pain split, psycho shift, spider web, sketch, swagger, switcheroo, trick, worry seed, and yawn.  A Pokémon affected by yawn before summoning the doll will still fall to sleep.

The doll blocks intimidate, but all other abilities act as though the doll did not exist.  If the user has an ability that absorbs moves of a certain type for HP (such as volt absorb absorbing thunder wave), such moves will not be blocked.

life orb and berries that cause confusion still work as normal, but their respective HP loss and confusion are absorbed/blocked by the doll.

The user is still vulnerable to damage inflicted when entering or leaving the field, such as by pursuit or spikes; however, the doll will block the poison effect of toxic spikes.

The doll is passed on by baton pass.  It keeps its existing HP, but uses the replacement Pokémon's stats and types for damage calculation.

All other effects work as normal.

machine.name: rock-smash
machine.description:
The user attacks with a punch. This may also lower
the target’s Defense stat.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 50% chance to lower the target's Defense by one stage.

level-up.name: tackle
level-up.description:
A physical attack in which the user charges and
slams into the target with its whole body.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.

level-up.name: leer
level-up.description:
The user gives opposing Pokémon an intimidating
leer that lowers the Defense stat.
level-up.effect: Lowers the target's Defense by one stage.

level-up.name: bite
level-up.description:
The target is bitten with viciously sharp fangs.
This may also make the target flinch.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.

level-up.name: low-kick
level-up.description:
A powerful low kick that makes the target fall over.
The heavier the target, the greater the move’s power.
level-up.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases with the target's weight in kilograms, to a maximum of 120.

Target's weight | Power
--------------- | ----:
Up to 10kg      |    20
Up to 25kg      |    40
Up to 50kg      |    60
Up to 100kg     |    80
Up to 200kg     |   100
Above 200kg     |   120

level-up.name: rototiller
level-up.description:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
level-up.effect: Raises the Attack and Special Attack of all grass Pokémon in battle.

level-up.name: leer
level-up.description:
The user gives opposing Pokémon an intimidating
leer that lowers the Defense stat.
level-up.effect: Lowers the target's Defense by one stage.

level-up.name: bite
level-up.description:
The target is bitten with viciously sharp fangs.
This may also make the target flinch.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.

level-up.name: bide
level-up.description:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
level-up.effect:
User waits for two turns.  On the second turn, the user inflicts twice the damage it accumulated on the last Pokémon to hit it.  Damage inflicted is typeless.

This move cannot be selected by sleep talk.

level-up.name: detect
level-up.description:
This move enables the user to protect itself from
all attacks. Its chance of failing rises if it is used
in succession.
level-up.effect:
No moves will hit the user for the remainder of this turn.  If the user is last to act this turn, this move will fail.

If the user successfully used detect, endure, protect, quick guard, or wide guard on the last turn, this move has a 50% chance to fail.

lock on, mind reader, and no guard provide a (100 – accuracy)% chance for moves to break through this move.  This does not apply to one-hit KO moves (fissure, guillotine, horn drill, and sheer cold); those are always blocked by this move.

thunder during rain dance and blizzard during hail have a 30% chance to break through this move.

The following effects are not prevented by this move:

* acupressure from an ally
* curse's curse effect
* Delayed damage from doom desire and future sight; however, these moves will be prevented if they are used this turn
* feint, which will also end this move's protection after it hits
* imprison
* perish song
* shadow force
* Moves that merely copy the user, such as transform or psych up

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.

level-up.name: sand-attack
level-up.description:
Sand is hurled in the target’s face, reducing the
target’s accuracy.
level-up.effect: Lowers the target's accuracy by one stage.

level-up.name: crunch
level-up.description:
The user crunches up the target with sharp fangs.
This may also lower the target’s Defense stat.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 20% chance to lower the target's Defense by one stage.

level-up.name: hypnosis
level-up.description:
The user employs hypnotic suggestion to make the
target fall into a deep sleep.
level-up.effect: Puts the target to sleep.

level-up.name: confuse-ray
level-up.description:
The target is exposed to a sinister ray that
triggers confusion.
level-up.effect: Confuses the target.

level-up.name: super-fang
level-up.description:
The user chomps hard on the target with its sharp
front fangs. This cuts the target’s HP in half.
level-up.effect: Inflicts typeless damage equal to half the target's remaining HP.

level-up.name: after-you
level-up.description:
The user helps the target and makes it use its move
right after the user.
level-up.effect:
The target will act next this turn, regardless of Speed or move priority.
If the target has already acted this turn, this move will fail.

level-up.name: psych-up
level-up.description:
The user hypnotizes itself into copying any stat
change made by the target.
level-up.effect:
Discards the user's stat changes and copies the target's.

This move cannot be copied by mirror move.

level-up.name: hyper-fang
level-up.description:
The user bites hard on the target with its sharp
front fangs. This may also make the target flinch.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to make the target flinch.

level-up.name: mean-look
level-up.description:
The user pins the target with a dark, arresting look.
The target becomes unable to flee.
level-up.effect:
The target cannot switch out normally.  Ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.  This effect ends when the user leaves the field.

The target may still escape by using baton pass, u turn, or a shed shell.

Both the user and the target pass on this effect with baton pass.

level-up.name: baton-pass
level-up.description:
The user switches places with a party Pokémon in
waiting and passes along any stat changes.
level-up.effect:
User switches out, and the trainer selects a replacement Pokémon from the party.  Stat changes, confusion, and persistent move effects are passed along to the replacement Pokémon.

The following move effects are passed:

* aqua ring
* both the user's and target's effect of block, mean look, and spider web
* the curse effect of curse
* embargo
* focus energy or an activated lansat berry
* gastro acid
* ingrain
* being sapped by leech seed
* being targeted by lock on or mind reader
* magnet rise
* perish song's counter
* power trick
* substitute; the doll's HP is unchanged

The replacement Pokémon does not trigger effects that respond to Pokémon switching in.

level-up.name: slam
level-up.description:
The target is slammed with a long tail, vines, or the
like to inflict damage.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.

machine.name: cut
machine.description: The target is cut with a scythe or claw.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.

machine.name: strength
machine.description:
The target is slugged with a punch thrown at
maximum power.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.

machine.name: toxic
machine.description:
A move that leaves the target badly poisoned.
Its poison damage worsens every turn.
machine.effect: Badly poisons the target.  Never misses when used by a poison-type Pokémon.

machine.name: hidden-power
machine.description:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  Power and type are determined by the user's IVs.

Power is given by `x * 40 / 63 + 30`.  `x` is obtained by arranging bit 1 from the IV for each of Special Defense, Special Attack, Speed, Defense, Attack, and HP in that order.  (Bit 1 is 1 if the IV is of the form `4n + 2` or `4n + 3`.  `x` is then 64 * Special Defense IV bit 1, plus 32 * Special Attack IV bit 1, etc.)

Power is always between 30 and 70, inclusive.  Average power is 49.5.

Type is given by `y * 15 / 63`, where `y` is similar to `x` above, except constructed from bit 0.  (Bit 0 is 1 if the IV is odd.)  The result is looked up in the following table.

Value | Type
----: | --------
    0 | fighting
    1 | flying
    2 | poison
    3 | ground
    4 | rock
    5 | bug
    6 | ghost
    7 | steel
    8 | fire
    9 | water
   10 | grass
   11 | electric
   12 | psychic
   13 | ice
   14 | dragon
   15 | dark

This move thus cannot be normal.  Most other types have an equal 1/16 chance to be selected, given random IVs.  However, due to the flooring used here, bug, fighting, and grass appear 5/64 of the time, and dark only 1/64 of the time.

machine.name: confide
machine.description:
The user tells the target a secret, and the target
loses its ability to concentrate. This lowers
the target’s Sp. Atk stat.
machine.effect: Lowers the target's Special Attack by one stage.

machine.name: sunny-day
machine.description:
The user intensifies the sun for five turns, powering
up Fire-type moves. It lowers the power of
Water-type moves.
machine.effect:
Changes the weather to sunshine for five turns, during which fire moves inflict 50% extra damage, and water moves inflict half damage.

If the user is holding heat rock, this effect lasts for eight turns.

Pokémon cannot become frozen.

thunder has 50% accuracy.

solar beam skips its charge turn.

moonlight, morning sun, and synthesis heal 2/3 of the user's max HP.

Pokémon with chlorophyll have doubled original Speed.

Pokémon with forecast become fire.

Pokémon with leaf guard are not affected by major status effects.

Pokémon with flower gift change form; every Pokémon on their side of the field have their original Attack and Special Attack increased by 50%.

Pokémon with dry skin lose 1/8 max HP at the end of each turn.

Pokémon with solar power have their original Special Attack raised by 50% but lose 1/8 their max HP at the end of each turn.

machine.name: hyper-beam
machine.description:
The target is attacked with a powerful beam.
The user can’t move on the next turn.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  User loses its next turn to "recharge", and cannot attack or switch out during that turn.

machine.name: light-screen
machine.description:
A wondrous wall of light is put up to reduce damage
from special attacks for five turns.
machine.effect:
Erects a barrier around the user's side of the field that reduces damage from special attacks by half for five turns.  In double battles, the reduction is 1/3.  Critical hits are not affected by the barrier.

If the user is holding light clay, the barrier lasts for eight turns.

brick break or defog used by an opponent will destroy the barrier.

machine.name: protect
machine.description:
This move enables the user to protect itself from
all attacks. Its chance of failing rises if it is used
in succession.
machine.effect:
No moves will hit the user for the remainder of this turn.  If the user is last to act this turn, this move will fail.

If the user successfully used detect, endure, protect, quick guard, or wide guard on the last turn, this move has a 50% chance to fail.

lock on, mind reader, and no guard provide a (100 – accuracy)% chance for moves to break through this move.  This does not apply to one-hit KO moves (fissure, guillotine, horn drill, and sheer cold); those are always blocked by this move.

thunder during rain dance and blizzard during hail have a 30% chance to break through this move.

The following effects are not prevented by this move:

* acupressure from an ally
* curse's curse effect
* Delayed damage from doom desire and future sight; however, these moves will be prevented if they are used this turn
* feint, which will also end this move's protection after it hits
* imprison
* perish song
* shadow force
* Moves that merely copy the user, such as transform or psych up

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.

machine.name: rain-dance
machine.description:
The user summons a heavy rain that falls for five
turns, powering up Water-type moves. It lowers
the power of Fire-type moves.
machine.effect:
Changes the weather to rain for five turns, during which water moves inflict 50% extra damage, and fire moves inflict half damage.

If the user is holding damp rock, this effect lasts for eight turns.

thunder has 100% accuracy.  If the target has used detect or protect, thunder has a (100 - accuracy)% chance to break through the protection.

solar beam has half power.

moonlight, morning sun, and synthesis heal only 1/4 of the user's max HP.

Pokémon with swift swim have doubled original Speed.

Pokémon with forecast become water.

Pokémon with dry skin heal 1/8 max HP, Pokémon with hydration are cured of major status effects, and Pokémon with rain dish heal 1/16 max HP at the end of each turn.

machine.name: frustration
machine.description:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases inversely with happiness, given by `(255 - happiness) * 2 / 5`, to a maximum of 102.  Power bottoms out at 1.

machine.name: thunderbolt
machine.description:
A strong electric blast crashes down on the target.
This may also leave the target with paralysis.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to paralyze the target.

machine.name: thunder
machine.description:
A wicked thunderbolt is dropped on the target to
inflict damage. This may also leave the target
with paralysis.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to paralyze the target.

During rain dance, this move has 100% accuracy.  It also has a (100 - accuracy)% chance to break through the protection of protect and detect.

During sunny day, this move has 50% accuracy.

machine.name: return
machine.description:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases with happiness, given by `happiness * 2 / 5`, to a maximum of 102.  Power bottoms out at 1.

machine.name: dig
machine.description:
The user burrows into the ground, then attacks on
the next turn.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  User digs underground for one turn, becoming immune to attack, and hits on the second turn.

During the immune turn, earthquake, fissure, and magnitude still hit the user normally, and their power is doubled if appropriate.

The user may be hit during its immune turn if under the effect of lock on, mind reader, or no guard.

This move cannot be selected by sleep talk.

machine.name: shadow-ball
machine.description:
The user hurls a shadowy blob at the target.
This may also lower the target’s Sp. Def stat.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 20% chance to lower the target's Special Defense by one stage.

machine.name: double-team
machine.description:
By moving rapidly, the user makes illusory copies of
itself to raise its evasiveness.
machine.effect: Raises the user's evasion by one stage.

machine.name: flamethrower
machine.description:
The target is scorched with an intense blast of fire.
This may also leave the target with a burn.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to burn the target.

machine.name: facade
machine.description:
This attack move doubles its power if the user is
poisoned, burned, or paralyzed.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  If the user is burned, paralyzed, or poisoned, this move has double power.

machine.name: rest
machine.description:
The user goes to sleep for two turns. This fully
restores the user’s HP and heals any
status conditions.
machine.effect:
User falls to sleep and immediately regains all its HP.  If the user has another major status effect, sleep will replace it.  The user will always wake up after two turns, or one turn with early bird.

This move fails if the Pokémon cannot fall asleep due to uproar, insomnia, or vital spirit.  It also fails if the Pokémon is at full health or is already asleep.

machine.name: attract
machine.description:
If it is the opposite gender of the user, the target
becomes infatuated and less likely to attack.
machine.effect: Causes the target to fall in love with the user, giving it a 50% chance to do nothing each turn.  If the user and target are the same gender, or either is genderless, this move will fail.  If either Pokémon leaves the field, this effect ends.

machine.name: round
machine.description:
The user attacks the target with a song. Others can
join in the Round to increase the power of
the attack.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  If round has already been used this turn, this move's power is doubled.  After this move is used, any other Pokémon using it this turn will immediately do so (in the order they would otherwise act), regardless of Speed or priority.  Pokémon using other moves will then continue to act as usual.

machine.name: focus-blast
machine.description:
The user heightens its mental focus and unleashes
its power. This may also lower the target’s
Sp. Def stat.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to lower the target's Special Defense by one stage.

machine.name: fling
machine.description:
The user flings its held item at the target to attack.
This move’s power and effects depend on the item.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  Power and type are determined by the user's held item.  The item is consumed.  If the user is not holding an item, or its item has no set type and power, this move will fail.

This move ignores sticky hold.

If the user is under the effect of embargo, this move will fail.

machine.name: retaliate
machine.description:
The user gets revenge for a fainted ally. If an ally
fainted in the previous turn, this move’s power
is increased.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  If a friendly Pokémon fainted on the previous turn, this move has double power.

machine.name: giga-impact
machine.description:
The user charges at the target using every bit of its
power. The user can’t move on the next turn.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  User loses its next turn to "recharge", and cannot attack or switch out during that turn.

machine.name: flash
machine.description:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
machine.effect: Lowers the target's accuracy by one stage.

machine.name: thunder-wave
machine.description:
The user launches a weak jolt of electricity that
paralyzes the target.
machine.effect: Paralyzes the target.

machine.name: swords-dance
machine.description:
A frenetic dance to uplift the fighting spirit.
This sharply raises the user’s Attack stat.
machine.effect: Raises the user's Attack by two stages.

machine.name: psych-up
machine.description:
The user hypnotizes itself into copying any stat
change made by the target.
machine.effect:
Discards the user's stat changes and copies the target's.

This move cannot be copied by mirror move.

machine.name: dream-eater
machine.description:
The user eats the dreams of a sleeping target.
The user’s HP is restored by half the damage taken by
the target.
machine.effect: Fails if not used on a sleeping Pokémon.  Inflicts regular damage.  Drains half the damage inflicted to heal the user.

machine.name: grass-knot
machine.description:
The user snares the target with grass and trips it.
The heavier the target, the greater the
move’s power.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases with the target's weight in kilograms, to a maximum of 120.

Target's weight | Power
--------------- | ----:
Up to 10kg      |    20
Up to 25kg      |    40
Up to 50kg      |    60
Up to 100kg     |    80
Up to 200kg     |   100
Above 200kg     |   120

machine.name: swagger
machine.description:
The user enrages and confuses the target. However,
this also sharply raises the target’s Attack stat.
machine.effect: Raises the target's Attack by two stages, then confuses it.  If the target's Attack cannot be raised by two stages, the confusion is not applied.

machine.name: sleep-talk
machine.description:
While it is asleep, the user randomly uses one of the
moves it knows.
machine.effect:
Only usable if the user is sleeping.  Randomly selects and uses one of the user's other three moves.  Use of the selected move requires and costs 0 PP.

This move will not select assist, bide, bounce, chatter, copycat, dig, dive, fly, focus punch, me first, metronome, mirror move, shadow force, skull bash, sky attack, sky drop, sleep talk, solar beam, razor wind, or uproar.

If the selected move requires a recharge turn—i.e., one of blast burn, frenzy plant, giga impact, hydro cannon, hyper beam, roar of time, or rock wrecker—and the user is still sleeping next turn, then it's forced to use this move again and pay another PP for the recharge turn.

This move cannot be copied by mirror move, nor selected by assist, metronome, or sleep talk.

machine.name: substitute
machine.description:
The user creates a substitute for itself using some of
its HP. The substitute serves as the user’s decoy.
machine.effect:
Transfers 1/4 the user's max HP into a doll that absorbs damage and causes most negative move effects to fail.  If the user leaves the field, the doll will vanish.  If the user cannot pay the HP cost, this move will fail.

The doll takes damage as normal, using the user's stats and types, and will break when its HP reaches zero.  Self-inflicted damage from confusion or recoil is not absorbed.  Healing effects from opponents ignore the doll and heal the user as normal.  Moves that work based on the user's HP still do so; the doll's HP does not influence any move.

The doll will block major status effects, confusion, and flinching.  The effects of smelling salts and wake up slap do not trigger against a doll, even if the Pokémon behind the doll has the appropriate major status effect.  Multi-turn trapping moves like wrap will hit the doll for their regular damage, but the multi-turn trapping and damage effects will not activate.

Moves blocked or damage absorbed by the doll do not count as hitting the user or inflicting damage for any effects that respond to such, e.g., avalanche, counter, or a rowap berry.  magic coat still works as normal, even against moves the doll would block.  Opposing Pokémon that damage the doll with a leech move like absorb are healed as normal.

It will also block acupressure, block, the curse effect of curse, dream eater, embargo, flatter, gastro acid, grudge, heal block, leech seed, lock on, mean look, mimic, mind reader, nightmare, pain split, psycho shift, spider web, sketch, swagger, switcheroo, trick, worry seed, and yawn.  A Pokémon affected by yawn before summoning the doll will still fall to sleep.

The doll blocks intimidate, but all other abilities act as though the doll did not exist.  If the user has an ability that absorbs moves of a certain type for HP (such as volt absorb absorbing thunder wave), such moves will not be blocked.

life orb and berries that cause confusion still work as normal, but their respective HP loss and confusion are absorbed/blocked by the doll.

The user is still vulnerable to damage inflicted when entering or leaving the field, such as by pursuit or spikes; however, the doll will block the poison effect of toxic spikes.

The doll is passed on by baton pass.  It keeps its existing HP, but uses the replacement Pokémon's stats and types for damage calculation.

All other effects work as normal.

machine.name: rock-smash
machine.description:
The user attacks with a punch. This may also lower
the target’s Defense stat.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 50% chance to lower the target's Defense by one stage.

machine.name: power-up-punch
machine.description:
Striking opponents over and over makes the user’s
fists harder. Hitting a target raises the Attack stat.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Raises the user's Attack by one stage.

level-up.name: confuse-ray
level-up.description:
The target is exposed to a sinister ray that
triggers confusion.
level-up.effect: Confuses the target.

level-up.name: tackle
level-up.description:
A physical attack in which the user charges and
slams into the target with its whole body.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.

level-up.name: leer
level-up.description:
The user gives opposing Pokémon an intimidating
leer that lowers the Defense stat.
level-up.effect: Lowers the target's Defense by one stage.

level-up.name: low-kick
level-up.description:
A powerful low kick that makes the target fall over.
The heavier the target, the greater the move’s power.
level-up.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases with the target's weight in kilograms, to a maximum of 120.

Target's weight | Power
--------------- | ----:
Up to 10kg      |    20
Up to 25kg      |    40
Up to 50kg      |    60
Up to 100kg     |    80
Up to 200kg     |   100
Above 200kg     |   120

level-up.effect: Confuses the target.

target fall into a deep sleep.

change made by the target.
level-up.effect:

level-up.effect: Raises the user's Special Attack by two stages.

The following move effects are passed:

* the curse effect of curse
* embargo
* focus energy or an activated lansat berry
* gastro acid
* ingrain
* being sapped by leech seed
* being targeted by lock on or mind reader
* magnet rise
* perish song's counter
* power trick
* substitute; the doll's HP is unchanged

The replacement Pokémon does not trigger effects that respond to Pokémon switching in.

level-up.name: slam
level-up.description:
The target is slammed with a long tail, vines, or the
like to inflict damage.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.

machine.name: work-up
machine.description:
The user is roused, and its Attack and Sp. Atk
stats increase.
machine.effect: Raises the user's Attack and Special Attack by one stage each.

machine.name: toxic
machine.description:
A move that leaves the target badly poisoned.
Its poison damage worsens every turn.
machine.effect: Badly poisons the target.  Never misses when used by a poison-type Pokémon.

machine.name: hidden-power
machine.description:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  Power and type are determined by the user's IVs.

Power is given by `x * 40 / 63 + 30`.  `x` is obtained by arranging bit 1 from the IV for each of Special Defense, Special Attack, Speed, Defense, Attack, and HP in that order.  (Bit 1 is 1 if the IV is of the form `4n + 2` or `4n + 3`.  `x` is then 64 * Special Defense IV bit 1, plus 32 * Special Attack IV bit 1, etc.)

Power is always between 30 and 70, inclusive.  Average power is 49.5.

Type is given by `y * 15 / 63`, where `y` is similar to `x` above, except constructed from bit 0.  (Bit 0 is 1 if the IV is odd.)  The result is looked up in the following table.

Value | Type
----: | --------
    0 | fighting
    1 | flying
    2 | poison
    3 | ground
    4 | rock
    5 | bug
    6 | ghost
    7 | steel
    8 | fire
    9 | water
   10 | grass
   11 | electric
   12 | psychic
   13 | ice
   14 | dragon
   15 | dark

This move thus cannot be normal.  Most other types have an equal 1/16 chance to be selected, given random IVs.  However, due to the flooring used here, bug, fighting, and grass appear 5/64 of the time, and dark only 1/64 of the time.

machine.name: confide
machine.description:
The user tells the target a secret, and the target
loses its ability to concentrate. This lowers
the target’s Sp. Atk stat.
machine.effect: Lowers the target's Special Attack by one stage.

machine.name: sunny-day
machine.description:
The user intensifies the sun for five turns, powering
up Fire-type moves. It lowers the power of
Water-type moves.
machine.effect:
Changes the weather to sunshine for five turns, during which fire moves inflict 50% extra damage, and water moves inflict half damage.

If the user is holding heat rock, this effect lasts for eight turns.

Pokémon cannot become frozen.

thunder has 50% accuracy.

solar beam skips its charge turn.

moonlight, morning sun, and synthesis heal 2/3 of the user's max HP.

Pokémon with chlorophyll have doubled original Speed.

Pokémon with forecast become fire.

Pokémon with leaf guard are not affected by major status effects.

Pokémon with flower gift change form; every Pokémon on their side of the field have their original Attack and Special Attack increased by 50%.

Pokémon with dry skin lose 1/8 max HP at the end of each turn.

Pokémon with solar power have their original Special Attack raised by 50% but lose 1/8 their max HP at the end of each turn.

machine.name: hyper-beam
machine.description:
The target is attacked with a powerful beam.
The user can’t move on the next turn.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  User loses its next turn to "recharge", and cannot attack or switch out during that turn.

machine.name: light-screen
machine.description:
A wondrous wall of light is put up to reduce damage
from special attacks for five turns.
machine.effect:
Erects a barrier around the user's side of the field that reduces damage from special attacks by half for five turns.  In double battles, the reduction is 1/3.  Critical hits are not affected by the barrier.

If the user is holding light clay, the barrier lasts for eight turns.

brick break or defog used by an opponent will destroy the barrier.

machine.name: protect
machine.description:
This move enables the user to protect itself from
all attacks. Its chance of failing rises if it is used
in succession.
machine.effect:
No moves will hit the user for the remainder of this turn.  If the user is last to act this turn, this move will fail.

If the user successfully used detect, endure, protect, quick guard, or wide guard on the last turn, this move has a 50% chance to fail.

lock on, mind reader, and no guard provide a (100 – accuracy)% chance for moves to break through this move.  This does not apply to one-hit KO moves (fissure, guillotine, horn drill, and sheer cold); those are always blocked by this move.

thunder during rain dance and blizzard during hail have a 30% chance to break through this move.

The following effects are not prevented by this move:

* acupressure from an ally
* curse's curse effect
* Delayed damage from doom desire and future sight; however, these moves will be prevented if they are used this turn
* feint, which will also end this move's protection after it hits
* imprison
* perish song
* shadow force
* Moves that merely copy the user, such as transform or psych up

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.

machine.name: rain-dance
machine.description:
The user summons a heavy rain that falls for five
turns, powering up Water-type moves. It lowers
the power of Fire-type moves.
machine.effect:
Changes the weather to rain for five turns, during which water moves inflict 50% extra damage, and fire moves inflict half damage.

If the user is holding damp rock, this effect lasts for eight turns.

thunder has 100% accuracy.  If the target has used detect or protect, thunder has a (100 - accuracy)% chance to break through the protection.

solar beam has half power.

moonlight, morning sun, and synthesis heal only 1/4 of the user's max HP.

Pokémon with swift swim have doubled original Speed.

Pokémon with forecast become water.

Pokémon with dry skin heal 1/8 max HP, Pokémon with hydration are cured of major status effects, and Pokémon with rain dish heal 1/16 max HP at the end of each turn.

machine.name: frustration
machine.description:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases inversely with happiness, given by `(255 - happiness) * 2 / 5`, to a maximum of 102.  Power bottoms out at 1.

machine.name: thunderbolt
machine.description:
A strong electric blast crashes down on the target.
This may also leave the target with paralysis.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to paralyze the target.

machine.name: thunder
machine.description:
A wicked thunderbolt is dropped on the target to
inflict damage. This may also leave the target
with paralysis.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to paralyze the target.

During rain dance, this move has 100% accuracy.  It also has a (100 - accuracy)% chance to break through the protection of protect and detect.

During sunny day, this move has 50% accuracy.

machine.name: return
machine.description:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases with happiness, given by `happiness * 2 / 5`, to a maximum of 102.  Power bottoms out at 1.

machine.name: shadow-ball
machine.description:
The user hurls a shadowy blob at the target.
This may also lower the target’s Sp. Def stat.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 20% chance to lower the target's Special Defense by one stage.

machine.name: double-team
machine.description:
By moving rapidly, the user makes illusory copies of
itself to raise its evasiveness.
machine.effect: Raises the user's evasion by one stage.

machine.name: flamethrower
machine.description:
The target is scorched with an intense blast of fire.
This may also leave the target with a burn.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to burn the target.

machine.name: facade
machine.description:
This attack move doubles its power if the user is
poisoned, burned, or paralyzed.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  If the user is burned, paralyzed, or poisoned, this move has double power.

machine.name: rest
machine.description:
The user goes to sleep for two turns. This fully
restores the user’s HP and heals any
status conditions.
machine.effect:
User falls to sleep and immediately regains all its HP.  If the user has another major status effect, sleep will replace it.  The user will always wake up after two turns, or one turn with early bird.

This move fails if the Pokémon cannot fall asleep due to uproar, insomnia, or vital spirit.  It also fails if the Pokémon is at full health or is already asleep.

machine.name: attract
machine.description:
If it is the opposite gender of the user, the target
becomes infatuated and less likely to attack.
machine.effect: Causes the target to fall in love with the user, giving it a 50% chance to do nothing each turn.  If the user and target are the same gender, or either is genderless, this move will fail.  If either Pokémon leaves the field, this effect ends.

machine.name: round
machine.description:
The user attacks the target with a song. Others can
join in the Round to increase the power of
the attack.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  If round has already been used this turn, this move's power is doubled.  After this move is used, any other Pokémon using it this turn will immediately do so (in the order they would otherwise act), regardless of Speed or priority.  Pokémon using other moves will then continue to act as usual.

machine.name: focus-blast
machine.description:
The user heightens its mental focus and unleashes
its power. This may also lower the target’s
Sp. Def stat.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to lower the target's Special Defense by one stage.

machine.name: fling
machine.description:
The user flings its held item at the target to attack.
This move’s power and effects depend on the item.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  Power and type are determined by the user's held item.  The item is consumed.  If the user is not holding an item, or its item has no set type and power, this move will fail.

This move ignores sticky hold.

If the user is under the effect of embargo, this move will fail.

machine.name: giga-impact
machine.description:
The user charges at the target using every bit of its
power. The user can’t move on the next turn.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  User loses its next turn to "recharge", and cannot attack or switch out during that turn.

machine.name: thunder-wave
machine.description:
The user launches a weak jolt of electricity that
paralyzes the target.
machine.effect: Paralyzes the target.

machine.name: swords-dance
machine.description:
A frenetic dance to uplift the fighting spirit.
This sharply raises the user’s Attack stat.
machine.effect: Raises the user's Attack by two stages.

machine.name: psych-up
machine.description:
The user hypnotizes itself into copying any stat
change made by the target.
machine.effect:
Discards the user's stat changes and copies the target's.

This move cannot be copied by mirror move.

machine.name: dream-eater
machine.description:
The user eats the dreams of a sleeping target.
The user’s HP is restored by half the damage taken by
the target.
machine.effect: Fails if not used on a sleeping Pokémon.  Inflicts regular damage.  Drains half the damage inflicted to heal the user.

machine.name: grass-knot
machine.description:
The user snares the target with grass and trips it.
The heavier the target, the greater the
move’s power.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases with the target's weight in kilograms, to a maximum of 120.

Target's weight | Power
--------------- | ----:
Up to 10kg      |    20
Up to 25kg      |    40
Up to 50kg      |    60
Up to 100kg     |    80
Up to 200kg     |   100
Above 200kg     |   120

machine.name: swagger
machine.description:
The user enrages and confuses the target. However,
this also sharply raises the target’s Attack stat.
machine.effect: Raises the target's Attack by two stages, then confuses it.  If the target's Attack cannot be raised by two stages, the confusion is not applied.

machine.name: sleep-talk
machine.description:
While it is asleep, the user randomly uses one of the
moves it knows.
machine.effect:
Only usable if the user is sleeping.  Randomly selects and uses one of the user's other three moves.  Use of the selected move requires and costs 0 PP.

This move will not select assist, bide, bounce, chatter, copycat, dig, dive, fly, focus punch, me first, metronome, mirror move, shadow force, skull bash, sky attack, sky drop, sleep talk, solar beam, razor wind, or uproar.

If the selected move requires a recharge turn—i.e., one of blast burn, frenzy plant, giga impact, hydro cannon, hyper beam, roar of time, or rock wrecker—and the user is still sleeping next turn, then it's forced to use this move again and pay another PP for the recharge turn.

This move cannot be copied by mirror move, nor selected by assist, metronome, or sleep talk.

machine.name: substitute
machine.description:
The user creates a substitute for itself using some of
its HP. The substitute serves as the user’s decoy.
machine.effect:
Transfers 1/4 the user's max HP into a doll that absorbs damage and causes most negative move effects to fail.  If the user leaves the field, the doll will vanish.  If the user cannot pay the HP cost, this move will fail.

The doll takes damage as normal, using the user's stats and types, and will break when its HP reaches zero.  Self-inflicted damage from confusion or recoil is not absorbed.  Healing effects from opponents ignore the doll and heal the user as normal.  Moves that work based on the user's HP still do so; the doll's HP does not influence any move.

The doll will block major status effects, confusion, and flinching.  The effects of smelling salts and wake up slap do not trigger against a doll, even if the Pokémon behind the doll has the appropriate major status effect.  Multi-turn trapping moves like wrap will hit the doll for their regular damage, but the multi-turn trapping and damage effects will not activate.

Moves blocked or damage absorbed by the doll do not count as hitting the user or inflicting damage for any effects that respond to such, e.g., avalanche, counter, or a rowap berry.  magic coat still works as normal, even against moves the doll would block.  Opposing Pokémon that damage the doll with a leech move like absorb are healed as normal.

It will also block acupressure, block, the curse effect of curse, dream eater, embargo, flatter, gastro acid, grudge, heal block, leech seed, lock on, mean look, mimic, mind reader, nightmare, pain split, psycho shift, spider web, sketch, swagger, switcheroo, trick, worry seed, and yawn.  A Pokémon affected by yawn before summoning the doll will still fall to sleep.

The doll blocks intimidate, but all other abilities act as though the doll did not exist.  If the user has an ability that absorbs moves of a certain type for HP (such as volt absorb absorbing thunder wave), such moves will not be blocked.

life orb and berries that cause confusion still work as normal, but their respective HP loss and confusion are absorbed/blocked by the doll.

The user is still vulnerable to damage inflicted when entering or leaving the field, such as by pursuit or spikes; however, the doll will block the poison effect of toxic spikes.

The doll is passed on by baton pass.  It keeps its existing HP, but uses the replacement Pokémon's stats and types for damage calculation.

All other effects work as normal.
